HashClass.desc: HashClass is a strict version of the Hash, implemented as a Class. So you can subclass it and Extend it. NOTE: Only supports accessing or setting data with methods. You can't use normal JS Object property access.

ObservableData.desc: ObservableData is just a bunch of methods that you can implement on your own classes that provide a standard interface to Observable classes.

ObservableHash.desc: ObservableHash, extends HashClass, implementing the ObservableData interface. This allows you to addEvents to the ObservableHash instance to observe when events fire for set() and get()
